commit_message:
Refactor the local engine to use an in process executor

Refactored launch script to start the API and executor on the same process
so the transport for a oslo.messaging fake driver can be shared. A transport
attribute is added to the abstract engine as a class attribute to reference
the transport object.

Change-Id: I4b8684ebded9eb993749f2503380e078087edd7d
Implements: blueprint mistral-inproc-executor
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/41/81941/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
#!/usr/bin/env python # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import eventlet eventlet.monkey_patch() import os import sys import threading # If ../mistral/__init__.py exists, add ../ to Python search path, so that # it will override what happens to be installed in /usr/(local/)lib/python... POSSIBLE_TOPDIR = os.path.normpath(os.path.join(os.path.abspath(sys.argv[0]), os.pardir, os.pardir)) if os.path.exists(os.path.join(POSSIBLE_TOPDIR, 'mistral', '__init__.py')): sys.path.insert(0, POSSIBLE_TOPDIR) from oslo import messaging from oslo.config import cfg from mistral import config from mistral.engine import engine from mistral.engine.scalable.executor import server from mistral.api import app from wsgiref import simple_server from mistral.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger('mistral.cmd.task_executor') def launch_executor(transport): try: # TODO(rakhmerov): This is a temporary hack. # We have to initialize engine in executor process because # executor now calls engine.convey_task_result() directly. engine.load_engine(transport) target = messaging.Target(topic=cfg.CONF.executor.topic, server=cfg.CONF.executor.host) endpoints = [server.Executor()] ex_server = messaging.get_rpc_server(transport, target, endpoints) ex_server.start() ex_server.wait() except RuntimeError, e: sys.stderr.write("ERROR: %s
" % e) sys.exit(1) def launch_api(transport): try: host = cfg.CONF.api.host port = cfg.CONF.api.port server = simple_server.make_server( host, port, app.setup_app(transport=transport)) LOG.info("Mistral API is serving on http://%s:%s (PID=%s)" % (host, port, os.getpid())) server.serve_forever() except RuntimeError, e: sys.stderr.write("ERROR: %s
" % e) sys.exit(1) def main(): try: config.parse_args() logging.setup('Mistral') # Please refer to the oslo.messaging documentation for transport # configuration. The default transport for oslo.messaging is rabbitMQ. # The available transport drivers are listed under oslo.messaging at # ./oslo/messaging/rpc/_drivers. The drivers are prefixed with "impl". # The transport driver is specified using the rpc_backend option in the # default section of the oslo configuration file. The expected value # for rpc_backend is the last part of the driver name. For example, # the driver for rabbit is impl_rabbit and for the fake driver is # impl_fake. The rpc_backend value for these are "rabbit" and "fake" # respectively. There are additional options such as ssl and credential # that can be specified depending on the driver. Please refer to the # driver implementation for those additional options. transport = messaging.get_transport(cfg.CONF) # launch the servers on different threads t1 = threading.Thread(target=launch_executor, args=(transport,)) t2 = threading.Thread(target=launch_api, args=(transport,)) t1.start() t2.start() t1.join() except RuntimeError, e: sys.stderr.write("ERROR: %s
" % e) sys.exit(1) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Make the baremetal-network configurable

Adds support for a new (optional) "baremetal-network" config
section to the testenv.json file. This JSON metadata can be used
to specify a custom baremetal network other than the hard coded
192.0.2.0/24 we have been using up until this point.

This effectively makes the flat network ranges used to bootstrap
the seed and undercloud fully configurable and can be very
useful when using the devtest scripts on real baremetal
(like some of us do for our CI/CD environments).

Change-Id: I6e89dc985fdd276a05f0e82c3905cc5efe646a4c

added_lines: ## LAN. The seed VM uses this network to bringing up nodes, and does its own ## DHCP etc, so do not connect it to a network## #. baremetal-network: A list of metadata describing the bare metal cloud ## network. This is a flat network which is used to bring up nodes via ## DHCP and transfer images. By default the rfc5735 TEST-NET-1 range - ## 192.0.2.0/24 is used. The following fields are available (along ## with the default values for each field): ## ## "baremetal-network": { ## "cidr": "192.0.2.0/24", ## "gateway-ip": "192.0.2.1", ## "seed": { ## "ip": "192.0.2.1", ## "range-start": "192.0.2.2", ## "range-end": "192.0.2.20" ## }, ## "undercloud": { ## "range-start": "192.0.2.21", ## "range-end": "192.0.2.40" ## } ## }

commit_message:
Read the configuration once for all func tests

Merge the swift_testing module into the functional test module itself,
so that we can read the configuration once for all unit tests, sharing
the same constraints.

Change-Id: I9fbbfdade9adca329cd79f7d4291ba009327c842

commit_message:
Temporary remove the cedarish install in devstack

This causes many job failures, (see
http://status.openstack.org/rechecks/ and Ctrl+F cedarish) and is
not used in our functionnal tests right now.

So remove it while we don't use it and investigate more on the
issue in order to activate it again when we have functionnal
tests using it

Fixes bug 1301894

Change-Id: Ie3de55559c7c8225b5f3e00f5eeec4519187b60b

subject: Fixed the pydev error message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-01 22:03:29.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/d3ba644ea91bbc62fbb652fa3b1b1b8d0cb41f4e', 'message': 'Fixed the pydev error message

Fixed the incorrect config parameter name in
the error message. pydev_worker_debug_host should
be used instead of pydev_worker_debug_port

Change-Id: I2e28474b591f5851623015fc0fb118b8cf254a16
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed the pydev error message

Fixed the incorrect config parameter name in
the error message. pydev_worker_debug_host should
be used instead of pydev_worker_debug_port

Change-Id: I2e28474b591f5851623015fc0fb118b8cf254a16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/65/84565/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ' option pydev_worker_debug_host is pointing to a valid '
deleted_lines: ' option pydev_worker_debug_port is pointing to a valid '

subject: VMware: treat cases when SOAP reply does not have a body
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-01 14:57:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware/commit/9697917c6e79c05e0ff8fe2e19f43a99d02fcf15', 'message': 'VMware: treat cases when SOAP reply does not have a body

There are cases when the SOAP reply does not return a body (for
example UnregisterVM may return this when running the CI).

This patch ensures that an exception is not thrown.

Change-Id: I394320641c648effd1209345cfd729e975f12aab
Closes-bug: #1300788
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-03 18:00:06.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_vim.py', 'oslo/vmware/vim.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware/commit/e39196b30bf0929e1148dc761e48780669676769', 'message': 'VMware: treat cases when SOAP reply does not have a body

commit_message:
VMware: treat cases when SOAP reply does not have a body

There are cases when the SOAP reply does not return a body (for
example UnregisterVM may return this when running the CI).

This patch ensures that an exception is not thrown.

Change-Id: I394320641c648effd1209345cfd729e975f12aab
Closes-bug: #1300788
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/65/84465/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if managed_object is None: return

commit_message:
Remove unused variables

o trove/backup/models.py:SWIFT_CONTAINER = CONF.backup_swift_container

commit_message:
Sync latest apiclient code from Oslo

We needs to update apiclient code to have ability to use it in py3 environment.

hanges from oslo-incubator related to apiclient
=====================================================================
Change 8575d87 - Removed copyright from empty files
Change bbaf317 - Use encode() instead of strutils.safe_encode() in fake_client
Change 41dc2b4 - Encode response from FakeHTTPClient
Change e6494c2 - Use six.iteritems to make dict work on Python2/3
Change 0d8f18b - Use urlutils functions instead of urllib/urllib2
Change 16fb43b - Replace data structures' attribute with six module
Change 9d0ec6a - Use six.iteritems for python 3.3 support in apiclient module
Change 12bcdb7 - Remove vim header
Change 4c22556 - Use py3kcompat urlutils functions instead of urlparse
Change 3970d46 - Fix typos in oslo
Change 1771a77 - Adjust import order according to PEP8 imports rule
Change da611e6 - Transform the for loop to expression
Change 4bfb7a2 - Apply six for metaclass
Change eca62f7 - Changed header from LLC to Foundation based on trademark policies

Change-Id: Ia87807828f344e463fa308413bd627dc57d1a41d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/16/63716/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change iogrp property when retyping for Storwize/SVC

If need migration when retyping, Storwize/SVC driver will add a copy
of the volume first, and then start a task to check volume sync
progress which will run each 10 mins. At last delete the origin copy
when sync finished.

But iogrp property is not a parameter of addvdiskcopy, so the iogrp
of the copy volume is the same as the origin. If iogrp property is
diff between the old and new volume type, the property will not
change when retyped.

Change-Id: Ie4414bcf95fa6e61d7d618618f48837eef740da4
closed-bug: #1298247

commit_message:
CLI for disable service reason

Adds cli option to allow users to give reason
for service-disable. Also adds disabled reason
as a column in service list, so any disabled service
can be seen with reason.

A recent cinder change that allows disable-log-reason
allows users to provide reason for disabling service.
This just adds the cli option for the method.

Implements bp record-reason-for-disabling-service

Change-Id: I90f4566764790eeb0c047c4a0fd0108050ab6ad9

commit_message:
replace assertTrue(isinstance) to assertIsInstance

some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use
assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools

Change-Id: Ic3eb7b27dc96b0ec7d786c092fc3a6a513af64f7
Closes-bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Add a timestamp parser for jquery tablesorter

In order to be able to sort columns containing timestamps,
a new parser for jquery tablesorter needs to be added.
This patch implements the above mentioned parser.

Change-Id: Ic02dc630082b3befbafd458c6fe9ddaba9d958ae
Implements: blueprint tablesorter-timestamp-parser
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/52/80252/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $.tablesorter.addParser({ id: "timestampSorter", is: function() { return false; }, format: function(s) { s = s.replace(/\-/g, " ").replace(/:/g, " "); s = s.replace("T", " ").replace("Z", " "); s = s.split(" "); return $.tablesorter.formatFloat( new Date(s[0], s[1], s[2], s[3], s[4], s[5]).getTime()); }, type: "numeric" }); } else if ($th.data('type') === 'timestamp'){ header_options[i] = {sorter: 'timestampSorter'};

commit_message:
Adds ionice command permutations to rootwrap filters

When setting volume_clear_ionice, the ionice command is prepended to a dd
command before executing it.  Previously, this would have failed because it
wasn't allowed through the default rootwrap filters.  This commit fixes this
problem.

Note that due to the way that the RegExpFilter works, we need three different
expressions to cover all cases.  This is because the various options result
in a different number of arguments.  And this filter will fail immediately
if the number of arguments is incorrect.

Change-Id: Ie29f7fa21b34982ed5394c2c8f38c3e066ef0112
Closes-Bug: #1300496

commit_message:
don't change auth_url port from user setting/config

The _change_port is used to fix keystone port from 5000 to 35357.
However if end users set their specified host with port or DNS based
url, the _change_port still change user settings

In this patch, _change_port is removed and instead we check whether the
auth_url is ADMIN api in verified_keystone methond which could block
process and print output to hints users correct their settings.

Change-Id: Id81c92a90f356cf6cb64a83314e49b9d3f53cfb2
Closes-Bug: #1285262

commit_message:
Add FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE and make it the default

Adds a new FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE option to lib/nova which
is by default enabled. Using config drive should speed
things up a bit and is a more likely production default
instead of file injection.

Change-Id: I2388ef0df12a6289b619bfaf30cb952fcc48ef41
(cherry picked from commit 24f6efadbdef558655abc5f1052bb61ae87b55f0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/74/82874/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Option to enable/disable config drive # NOTE: Set FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE="False" to turn OFF config drive FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE=${FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE:-"always"} if [ "$FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE" != "False" ]; then iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT force_config_drive "$FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE" fi

commit_message:
Git pull url validation

* Reads validation rules from Oslo config 'validate' group
* Checks git pull url max len
* Includes a whitelist and blacklist with allow, deny and ignore settings
* Adds a new InvalidInput exception for these kinds of checks

Partially implements: blueprint solum-input-validation
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/solum/+spec/solum-input-validation

Change-Id: I0d5ec4ae2e7122110f26c0d7ccce649783be0f96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/44/81644/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 - Rackspace # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo.config import cfg from solum.common import exception from solum.common import validate from solum.tests import base CONF = cfg.CONF class TestValidate(base.BaseTestCase): """Tests the validate module.""" def test_default_failures(self): """By default, all urls should fail.""" # Empty url self.assertRaises( exception.InvalidInput, validate.valid_git_url, ("")) # github-like url self.assertRaises( exception.InvalidInput, validate.valid_git_url, ("http://github.com/abc")) # Max length test CONF.validation.git_url_restrictions = {'test_case': '.*'} CONF.validation.git_url_state = {'test_case': 'allow'} max_len = CONF.validation.git_url_max_len self.assertRaises( exception.InvalidInput, validate.valid_git_url, ("a" * (max_len + 1))) # Check a conflicting allow and deny rule that match a given url CONF.validation.git_url_restrictions = ( {'test_case': '.*', 'deny_test': '.*'}) CONF.validation.git_url_state = ( {'test_case': 'allow', 'deny_test': 'deny'}) self.assertRaises( exception.InvalidInput, validate.valid_git_url, "a") def test_success_cases(self): """Test cases which should pass.""" max_len = CONF.validation.git_url_max_len # Enable github-like urls for testing CONF.validation.git_url_restrictions = ( {'test_case': '^https?://github.com/[a-z/_-]+$'}) CONF.validation.git_url_state = {'test_case': 'allow'} base_url = "http://github.com/" # github-like url validate.valid_git_url(base_url + "abc") # max length github-like url validate.valid_git_url(base_url + "z" * (max_len - len(base_url)))

subject: Add support for Logstash and Elasticsearch and Kibana
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-13 12:43:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/1bb1b86668bae9b1ea6362aea9e09d145e24c480', 'message': 'Add Logstash, Elasticsearch, Kibana prototype for logging

WIP
- Add logstash port parameter to listen onto
- Add InputFileReadMode for rsyslog::imfile (Default 0, line based)
- Add openstack::logfilter class for logstash
- Install and configure logstash, elasticsearch, kibana by its templates (default is fuel node)
- Provide rsyslog client sided templates for logstash remote logging as well as rsyslog ones
- Assume logstash defaults fuel:55514, udp - for anaconda logs capturing
(thus, logstash non-defaults should not be used for now)
- Use paragraph based message detection for rabbitmq (imfile)
- Use user facility and line based (default) message detection for openstack DEBUG (imfile)
- Ensure new logfiles introduced for logstash and elasticsearch are rotated
- Del config template for elasticsearch
- Remove double declaration, delegate templating to openstack::logfilter
- Skip paramedic plugin for elasticsearch
- Add cluster_name for elasticsearch, fix templates
- Change firewall rules for logstash
- Rename tag for non aplha numerical program names
- Send anaconda logs to logstash as well
- Assume logstash node is fuel:55514, udp
- Add grok tags for rfc5424 (bootstrap/anaconda)
- Fix rfc3164 pattern to make semicolon optional
- Fix grok pattern for debug case
- Fix kibana service and notification
- Restore class var debug were missed
- Extend rfc5424 grok pattern to match hostnames in message
- Fix config requirements and services notifications for logfilter
- Assume base syslog node (fuel master) is also logstash node
- Use tcp instead of udp
- Add grok pattern for netcatted logs
- Imrove stability of grok regexes
- Fix excluded tags and spaces parsing

Implements-blueprint: logstash-elasticsearch-kibana-for-logs
Depends on: Add puppet module for elasticsearch (80025)
Depends on: Add elasticsearch module for elasticsearch (80024)

Change-Id: I800049aa2d1102880c95ac49824bb655334411f3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add support for Logstash and Elasticsearch and Kibana

Apollo11 changes:
21abbc7 - Bartosz Kupidura, 9 months ago : Logstash module for PP
412499b - Bartosz Kupidura, 9 months ago : Heap_size as a parameter for logstash/init.pp
Fuel team changes:
- Extend jarfile to package provider for logstash
- Fix dep.packages for libzmq1
- Add logstash port parameter to listen onto
- Add InputFileReadMode for rsyslog::imfile (Default 0, line based)
- Add openstack::logfilter class for logstash
- Add openstack::logfilter class for logstash
  - Install and configure logstash, elasticsearch, kibana by its templates (default is undef)
  - Provide rsyslog client sided templates for logstash remote logging as well as rsyslog ones
  - Assume logstash defaults undef, :55514, udp - for provisioning logs capturing
  - Use paragraph based message detection for rabbitmq (imfile)
  - Use user facility and line based (default) message detection for openstack DEBUG (imfile)
  - Ensure new logfiles introduced for logstash and elasticsearch are rotated
* Del config template for elasticsearch
* Remove double declaration, delegate templating to openstack::logfilter
* Skip paramedic plugin for elasticsearch
* Add cluster_name for elasticsearch, fix templates
* Change firewall rules for logstash
* Rename tag for non aplha numerical program names
* Send anaconda logs to logstash as well (Assume logstash node is fuel:55514, udp)
* Add grok tags for rfc5424 (bootstrap/anaconda)
* Fix rfc3164 pattern to make simicolon optional
* Fix grok pattern for debug case
* Fix kibana service and notification
* Restore class var debug were missed
* Extend rfc5424 grok pattern to match hostnames in message
* Fix config requirements and services notifications for logfilter
* Assume base syslog node (fuel master) is the logstash node
* Use tcp instead of udp
* Add grok pattern for netcatted logs
* Imrove stability of grok regexes
* Fix excluded tags and spaces parsing
* Fix logging class defaults and broken spacing
* Fix firewall rules and dependencies for Logstash/ES
* Fix java ver. and package install for logstash
* Fix missed logstash_host, logstash_port params
* Add and ensure access for ES_DIRECTORY param (for ES 0.90.10+)
* Fix proto and Rabbit syslog facility usage for logstash rsyslog template
* Assume the 1st rsyslog server node is also logstash node
* Assume the logstash proto is the same as 1st rsyslog server has
* Assume the USER facility is dedicated for RabbitMQ server
* Fix wrong remote_type reference in rsyslog 00-remote template
* Logstash conf fixes
  - use UTF-8 explicitely
  - del experimental syslog_pri plugin usage,
  - fix grok patterns,
  - add grok for OS traces
* Fix etc rights for Elasticsearch 0.90.10+
* Fix logstash agent name
* Undo ES_DIRECTORY (support ES 0.90.0 only for now)
* Fix grok patterns

Implements-blueprint: logstash-elasticsearch-kibana-for-logs
Depends on 80025, 80024

Change-Id: I800049aa2d1102880c95ac49824bb655334411f3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add disk-image-edit utility to help edit images.

I often want to make ad-hoc changes to my existing
DIB images. Recreating a new image from scratch takes
many minutes... and often fails due to upstream dependency
issues.

This script has proven useful to me in that it allows
you to easily mount an image to the /tmp directory,
jump in and make changes (copy files, chroot it, whatever),
and then hit Ctrl-C to unmount the image.

Change-Id: I212f12643a4c666317459c08a32c62fd15adeda6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/58/71958/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Copyright 2013 Red Hat, Inc. # Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -e SCRIPTNAME=$(basename $0) SCRIPT_HOME=$(dirname $0) if [ -d $SCRIPT_HOME/../share/diskimage-builder ] then export _PREFIX=$SCRIPT_HOME/../share/diskimage-builder else export _PREFIX=$SCRIPT_HOME/.. fi export _LIB=$_PREFIX/lib source $_LIB/die function show_options () { echo "Usage: $SCRIPTNAME -i <image> [-d <outdir>] [-o <prefix]" echo echo "Options:" echo " -i image filename to edit" echo " -h -- print this message" exit 0 } TEMP=`getopt -o hi: -n $SCRIPTNAME -- "$@"` if [ $? != 0 ] ; then echo "Terminating..." >&2 ; exit 1 ; fi # Note the quotes around `$TEMP': they are essential! eval set -- "$TEMP" export OUT_DIR=/tmp export OUT_PFX=baremetal while true ; do case "$1" in -i) export IMAGE_FILE=$2; shift 2 ;; -h) show_options;; --) shift ; break ;; *) echo "Internal error!" ; exit 1 ;; esac done if [[ ! -n "$IMAGE_FILE" ]]; then die "You must specify an image to read from with -i \$filename" elif [[ ! -r "$IMAGE_FILE" ]]; then die "Image file $IMAGE_FILE is not readable" fi source $_LIB/img-defaults source $_LIB/common-functions source $_LIB/img-functions ensure_nbd # sets WORK_DIR mount_qcow_image $IMAGE_FILE echo "Image mounted at: $WORK_DIR" echo "Ctrl-C to unmount it and exit..." #unmount_qcow_image on Ctrl-C trap unmount_qcow_image INT while true; do sleep 1; done exit 0

commit_message:
Improve region support in nova

This patch adds a new parameter to the api
class that allows nova to authenticate
against a user specified region.

For use, e.g. attaching a volume to a
running instance when there are multiple
cinder endpoints across regions.

Change-Id: Ie609b0c43ffc2cb299686ebf85fb0cd7f1beddef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/19/82419/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ironic deployment docs

submitting again as space characters were added in.
Adding nova keypair , and few other changes on label
dadding some more outputs
readding as last build failed.
adding few outputs and changes to labels
adding deploy ref in index toctree.
Rechecking in as pep8 failed.
Adding a new directory deploy for deployment docs.
Removing empty spaces and characters from doc files

Change-Id: Ieb9a3ce7854792a72845db931b9cbcb9d458057d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/82/74282/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _deploying-ironic: =============== Deploy Ironic =============== setup network using tripleo for ironic:: git clone https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-incubator cd tripleo-incubator/ sudo service openvswitch start sudo ./scripts/setup-network set things up for dnsmasq to serve images:: sudo mkdir /var/lib/ironic sudo mkdir /tftpboot sudo chmod 777 /var/lib/ironic sudo chmod 777 /tftpboot cp /usr/share/syslinux/pxelinux.0 /tftpboottart dnsmasq: start dnsmasq:: sudo dnsmasq --conf-file= --port=69 --enable-tftp --tftp-root=/tftpboot --dhcp-boot=pxelinux.0 --pid-file=/var/run/dnsmasq.pid --interface=eth1 --dhcp-range=Lower address , upper address bound customize --interface and --dhcp-range to suit your network above. creating node:: Image UUIDs glance image-list ironic node-create -d pxe_ssh -i ssh_username=root -i ssh_password= <password of the root user of ur host machine> -i pxe_deploy_ramdisk= <deploy ramdisk uuid> -i pxe_deploy_kernel=<deploy kernel uuid> -i pxe_instance_name="test" -i pxe_image_source=<image uuid> -i pxe_root_gb=5 -i ssh_virt_type=virsh -i ssh_address=STATICIP - pxe_deploy_ramdisk is the UUID of the ramdisk (initrd) you built and imported into Glance. You can run glance image-list if you didnt happen to memorize the UUID> - pxe_deploy_kernel is the kernel (vmlinuz) built and imported into Glance. Its also in glance image-list. - The pxe_deploy_ramdisk and pxe_deploy_kernel parameters are what the node will PXE-boot. Theyll connect back to us and then grab the actual deploy image. - pxe_image_source (also in glance image-list) is the image that the node will ultimately end up with. We use a CirrOS image in testing. Output:: +--------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------+ | chassis_uuid | None | | driver | pxe_ssh | | driver_info | {u'pxe_deploy_ramdisk': u'90226263-226b-4739-9e54-4a17d95be1f9', | | | u'pxe_instance_name': u'test', u'pxe_image_source': | | | u'bf002818-54ff-4922-99b0-4d0ac57e6576', u'pxe_root_gb': u'5', | | | u'ssh_username': u'root', u'ssh_password': u'vinayaka', | | | u'pxe_deploy_kernel': u'd3d12df2-4a2b-4dc4-85dd-39a3a50b49ff', | | | u'ssh_address': u'192.168.122.1', u'ssh_virt_type': u'virsh'} | | extra | {} | | properties | {} | | uuid | 504bfc05-c190-49ec-9062-9b0753135ae4 | +--------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------+ create a port, which maps the node to its MAC:: $NODE=<node uuid returned above> $ironic port-create -n $NODE -a "08:00:27:9F:B5:79" (MAC ADDRESS) Output:: +--------------+-------------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +----------------+-----------------------------------------+ | address | 08:00:27:9f:b5:79 | | extra | {} | | node_uuid | 504bfc05-c190-49ec-9062-9b0753135ae4 | | uuid | 9b382e69-f739-4ca9-bf78-8a5b3b7c1700 | +--------------+-------------------------------------------+ Validate things with Ironic:: $ironic node-validate $NODE Getting auth_token:: $ironic debug node-list Set the token variable $TOKEN= Long token that gets printed by running above command. kick off a provision:: $curl -i -X PUT -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ -H 'Accept: application/json' \ -H 'User-Agent: python-ironicclient' \ -d '{"target": "active"}' \ http://127.0.0.1:6385/v1/nodes/$NODE/states/provision Watch machine changes:: $ironic node-show $NODE

subject: Add methods to check whether an ip is public or not

commit_message:
Add methods to check whether an ip is public or not

This first commit add 3 new methods in the module utils
to check if a given ip address is public or private.

Change-Id: I9d5c06d9850e56a558bfb3e4cf8d2bd0b87e22eb
Related-Bug: #1188031
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/77/83077/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class IpAddressTestCase(test_utils.TestCase): def test_inet_aton_bad_version(self): self.assertRaises( ValueError, utils.inet_aton, '8.8.8.8', 3) def test_inet_aton_bad_address(self): self.assertRaises( ValueError, utils.inet_aton, '8.8.8.', 4) def test_inet_aton_succes(self): self.assertEqual(utils.inet_aton('0.0.0.1', 4), 1) self.assertEqual(utils.inet_aton('0.0.1.0', 4), 256) self.assertEqual(utils.inet_aton('0.1.0.0', 4), 65536) self.assertEqual(utils.inet_aton('1.0.0.0', 4), 16777216) self.assertEqual(utils.inet_aton('0:0:0:1:0:0:0:0', 6), 1) self.assertEqual(utils.inet_aton('0:0:1:0:0:0:0:0', 6), 65536) self.assertEqual(utils.inet_aton('0:1:0:0:0:0:0:0', 6), 4294967296) self.assertEqual( utils.inet_aton('1:0:0:0:0:0:0:0', 6), 281474976710656) def test_public_ip(self): self.assertTrue(utils.is_public_address('8.8.8.8', 4)) self.assertTrue(utils.is_public_address('2001:4860:4860::8888', 6)) def test_private_ip(self): self.assertTrue(utils.is_private_address('192.168.0.1', 4)) self.assertTrue(utils.is_private_address('127.0.0.1', 4)) self.assertTrue(utils.is_private_address('10.0.0.1', 4)) self.assertFalse(utils.is_private_address('0:0:0:1:0:0:0:0', 6))

commit_message:
Pass undercloud metadata to overcloud compute

Capture some limited undercloud metadata into the overcloud heat
templates, so the overcloud nodes can update themselves from
the undercloud glance. Not always used, but made available for
use when needed.

Change-Id: I56c07a1b51d7d30e92aa4abb825053db0a554fbc

commit_message:
Add more log info around 'Instance could not be found' error

- very rarely we get 404 response for:
    GET /${project_id}/servers/${instance_id}
inspite of the instance being active.
- current log message on nova api does not have enough info to debug
  this problem.
- hence included more log messages to print more info and the traceback of
  the exception raised for debugging the reason behind the
  'Instance could not be found' 404 error.

Co-authored-by: Sridevi Koushik <sridevi.koushik@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: If4a83b924f6a8f691289a4897e91b51a04e2261e
Closes-Bug: #1278849

commit_message:
Fixed error in container sync exc handling

If container sync got a non-ClientException and then a ClientException
during a get/put operation, it previously would break in the error
handling.

Change-Id: Ib2fa70270f3ec870bf60d5bbb3e8f514aeeb0927

subject: _translate_from_glance() can cause an unnecessary HTTP request
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-03 04:41:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/glance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/da13c6285bb0aee55cfbc93f55ce2e2b7d6a28f2', 'message': "_translate_from_glance() can cause an unnecessary HTTP request

After returning from a get() call to python-glanceclient, cinder runs a
translation function on the returned Image to get the data it wants. Part of
this process is checking for an expected set of attributes, one of which is
the deletion time ('deleted_at'). However, if the image has not been deleted,
deleted_at key will not exist. This forces another call to glance to occur for
the same image. A similar problem exists for the checksum attribute, which does
not exist before an image is active. The fix here is to only consider
deleted_at and checksum if they are expected to be present.

This change was made in nova as change I67b7dd16

Change-Id: Iedc16cb9316f9610fdb8ac03f448bc375a4e6bfa
Closes-Bug: #1275173
"}]
commit_message:
_translate_from_glance() can cause an unnecessary HTTP request

After returning from a get() call to python-glanceclient, cinder runs a
translation function on the returned Image to get the data it wants. Part of
this process is checking for an expected set of attributes, one of which is
the deletion time ('deleted_at'). However, if the image has not been deleted,
deleted_at key will not exist. This forces another call to glance to occur for
the same image. A similar problem exists for the checksum attribute, which does
not exist before an image is active. The fix here is to only consider
deleted_at and checksum if they are expected to be present.

This change was made in nova as change I67b7dd16

Change-Id: Iedc16cb9316f9610fdb8ac03f448bc375a4e6bfa
Closes-Bug: #1275173
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/37/84937/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #NOTE(hdd): If a key is not found, base.Resource.__getattr__() may perform # a get(), resulting in a useless request back to glance. This list is # therefore sorted, with dependent attributes as the end # 'deleted_at' depends on 'deleted' # 'checksum' depends on 'status' == 'active' 'container_format', 'status', 'id', 'deleted', 'deleted_at', 'checksum', for attr in IMAGE_ATTRIBUTES: if attr == 'deleted_at' and not output['deleted']: output[attr] = None elif attr == 'checksum' and output['status'] != 'active': output[attr] = None else: output[attr] = getattr(image, attr)
deleted_lines: 'container_format', 'checksum', 'id', 'deleted_at', 'deleted', 'status', for attr in IMAGE_ATTRIBUTES: output[attr] = getattr(image, attr, None)

commit_message:
Implement MidoNet plugin for Icehouse (Part 1)

Update the plugin to reflect the newest MidoNet API that mostly
mirrors the Neutron API.  Most of the Neutron API can now be
simply passed through to MidoNet, making the plugin easier to
maintain, and it provides better data synchronization since
most of MidoNet API operations are atomic.

Change-Id: If5a7c0541383d01d98d12c2365bbfcc4f30f60ff
Implements: blueprint midonet-plugin
Closes-Bug: #1244025
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Check reserve/unreserve fixed-ips APIs attributes

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 reserve & unreserve
fixed-ips APIs response and validate the response with added JSON
schema to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of V2 reserve & unreserve fixed-ip API is below:

{
    "202 Accepted The request is accepted for processing."
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: Ic837fb3cdc34a79c25589a7263f54b96b6043680

commit_message:
Allow volume filtering

This patch allows the EC2 API to filter volumes based on size,
volume type, and metadata.

Blueprint: ec2-volume-filtering
Change-Id: Icd915f30be8120a9c3fde602be66b442e4460709
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/62350/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #TODO(rushiagr): if filter 'volume_type' is specified as string 'None', # _all_ the volumes are returned. Quite contrastingly, when you specify # when an API call is directly made to Cinder with URL # '/v2/tenant_id/detail?volume_type=None', Cinder lists all volumes # with volume type 'None' (string 'None'), if they exist, else returns # no volumes. search_opts = ec2utils.search_opts_from_filters(kwargs.get('filter')) volumes = self.volume_api.get_all(context, search_opts=search_opts)

commit_message:
Add a file that can detail the requirements files

From the ML discussion there was a desire to provide
a more detailed version of the requirements that has
information such as license, author... This script
gathers such information from the pypi json API and
writes it to corresponding files that can be used by
automated programs that want to determine this information
without having to go to pypi themselves.

This can be useful for doing requirement license
auditing for example.

To run:

$ python detail.py global-requirements.txt

This will gather the information about the requirements
from pypi (if possible) and then write a new file located
at global-requirements.json with this information.

Change-Id: I710feb7038eec0c916593cce0837823e7f4fce15

added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright (C) 2014 Yahoo! Inc. All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from __future__ import print_function import contextlib import json import os import pkg_resources import sys import traceback import urllib try: PYPI_LOCATION = os.environ['PYPI_LOCATION'] except KeyError: PYPI_LOCATION = 'http://pypi.python.org/pypi' KEEP_KEYS = frozenset([ 'author', 'author_email', 'maintainer', 'maintainer_email', 'license', 'summary', 'home_page', ]) def release_data(req): url = PYPI_LOCATION + "/%s/json" % (req.key) with contextlib.closing(urllib.urlopen(url)) as uh: if uh.getcode() != 200: raise IOError("Could not find data for %s (%s)" % (req.key, uh.getcode())) return json.loads(uh.read()) def main(): if len(sys.argv) == 1: print("%s requirement-file ..." % (sys.argv[0]), file=sys.stderr) for filename in sys.argv[1:]: print("Analyzing file: %s" % (filename)) details = {} with open(filename, "rb") as fh: for line in fh.read().splitlines(): line = line.strip() if line.startswith("#") or not line: continue req = pkg_resources.Requirement.parse(line) print(" - processing: %s" % (req)) try: raw_req_data = release_data(req) except IOError: traceback.print_exc() details[req.key] = None else: req_info = {} for (k, v) in raw_req_data.get('info', {}).items(): if k not in KEEP_KEYS: continue req_info[k] = v details[req.key] = { 'requirement': str(req), 'info': req_info, } filename, _ext = os.path.splitext(filename) with open("%s.json" % (filename), "wb") as fh: fh.write(json.dumps(details, sort_keys=True, indent=4)) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Add missing mock for cinder.default_quota_get

When running tests, I get the following logs:

INFO:requests.packages.urllib3.connectionpool:Starting new HTTP connection (1):
public.nova.example.com

DEBUG:cinderclient.client:Connection refused:
HTTPConnectionPool(host='public.nova.example.com', port=8776): Max retries
exceeded with url: /v1/os-quota-sets/1/defaults (Caused by <class
'socket.gaierror'>: [Errno -2] Name or service not known)

Which signify, that there is a mock missing in the tests.
This patch adds that missing mock.

Change-Id: I4f79f533b729112d11c7165adde2ac751d49f46b
Closes-Bug: #1300141

commit_message:
Update neutron-adv-test to use openstackclient commands

There were a few references of keystoneclient in
exercises/neutron-adv-test.sh, this patch will change those
commands to their openstackclient equivalents.

Change-Id: I88892fcfacd3dd6354ec269b270cee3da358447a

commit_message:
Hide column on multi_select tables if no actions available.

This patch will add a runtime check to hide/show checkbox columns
on multi_select tables.
Right know the behaviour is calculated once but does not take in account
the dynamic allowed call of each Table Action available.

The change will add 'hidden' class to the first column if table actions
are present but all of them returned False on allowed() call.

Change-Id: Ia4512abe3dbb5de4581673717eb518b2d3a50291
Closes-Bug: #1271194
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/43/69243/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def enable_multiselect_column(self, enable=True): """hide checkbox column if no current table action is allowed.""" if self.multi_select: select_column = self.columns.values()[0] #to avoid creating a new list with compre list, #try to find the value hidden_found = 'hidden' in select_column.classes if hidden_found and enable: select_column.classes.remove('hidden') if not hidden_found and not enable: select_column.classes.append('hidden') self.enable_multiselect_column(len(bound_actions) > 0)

commit_message:
Edit docs to include git.openstack.org url

This patch proposes a change to clone the devstack repository from
git://git.openstack.org rather than https://github.com since git urls
are faster than https and put less loads on the server.

Change-Id: I7fe6a0f81be812dacfef575caa1cf0ae800f9a29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/52/84452/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MASTER_REPO=${MASTER_REPO:-https://git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/devstack}

commit_message:
Embrane plugin lacks db migration

This patch tracks all the changes needed in order to correctly enable Embrane's Neutron Plugin db migration.

Change-Id: I180eb53c853eaacde3906b7c01c5990347d6a603
Closes-Bug: #1298461

commit_message:
Removes useless wrapper from manager base class

There is no value to adding this extra layer to each method call.
Instead just return the boundmethod object itself.

Change-Id: I0eddb9fcb25bf9e20ae60d200c9538fbc426123c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/53/84553/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: setattr(self, name, f) return f
deleted_lines: @functools.wraps(f) def _wrapper(*args, **kw): return f(*args, **kw) setattr(self, name, _wrapper) return _wrapper

commit_message:
Allow deprecated volume update keys in v2

Keys like display_name and display_description were deprecated for other
actions in v2 like creating volumes, so for consistency they should work
with updating.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1301172
Change-Id: I19bc7c85352578bb57fa9fdaf1817f78e0ee2f2a

commit_message:
Fixes cinder volume delete on Windows

Because of the fact that an iSCSI target is not created anymore
at volume creation time, not all volumes will have a corresponding
target. For this reason, when removing an iSCSI target we must
first check if the target actually exists.

Change-Id: I8e571397df6d9a2eeb05e883b7da8494d4bfa1ad
Closes-Bug: #1299124
